item.title: Katie add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "There is still that singular perfection, and it's perfect in part because it seemed, at the time, so clearly to promise more." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Katie add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "Perhaps, in the extravagance of youth, we give away our devotions easily and all but arbitrarily, on the mistaken assumption that we’ll always have more to give." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Katie add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "We throw our parties; we abandon our families to live alone in Canada; we struggle to write books that do not change the world, despite our gifts and our unstinting efforts, our most extravagant hopes. We live our lives, do whatever we do, and then we sleep. It's as simple and ordinary as that. A few jump out windows, or drown themselves, or take pills; more die by accident; and most of us are slowly devoured by some disease, or, if we're very fortunate, by time itself. There's just this for consolation: an hour here or there when our lives seem, against all odds and expectations, to burst open and give us everything we've ever imagined, though everyone but children (and perhaps even they) know these hours will inevitably be followed by others, far darker and more difficult. Still, we cherish the city, the morning; we hope, more than anything, for more. Heaven only knows why we love it so..." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Katie add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: ". . . he felt himself entering a moment so real he could only run toward it, shouting." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Katie add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "She will remain sane and she will live as she was meant to live, richly and deeply, among others of her kind, in full possession and command of her gifts." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Katie add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "This is what you do. You make a future for yourself out of the raw material at hand." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Katie add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "..this indiscriminate love feels entirely serious to her, as if everything in the world is part of a vast, inscrutable intention and everything in the world has its own secret name, a name that cannot be conveyed in language but is simply the sight and feel of the thing itself." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Katie add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "a certain bohemian, good-witch sort of charm" -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Katie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "That was the year, my twenty-eighth, when I was discovering that not all of the promises would be kept, that some things are in fact irrevocable and that it had counted after all, every evasion and every procrastination, every mistake, every word, all of it." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Katie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "We tell ourselves stories in order to live." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Katie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Character — the willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life — is the source from which self-respect springs." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Katie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves--there lies the great, singular power of self-respect." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Katie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "A place belongs forever to whoever claims it hardest, remembers it most obsessively, wrenches it from itself, shapes it, renders it, loves it so radically that he remakes it in his own image." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Katie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "California is a place in which a boom mentality and a sense of Chekhovian loss meet in uneasy suspension; in which the mind is troubled by some buried but ineradicable suspicion that things better work here, because here, beneath the immense bleached sky,is where we run out of continent." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "Still, there are times I am bewildered by each mile I have traveled, each meal I have eaten, each person I have known, each room in which I have slept. As ordinary as it all appears, there are times when it is beyond my imagination." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "That's the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "He tries to peel the image from the sticky yellow backing, to show her the next time he sees her, but it clings stubbornly, refusing to detach cleanly from the past." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "She watched his lips forming the words, at the same time she heard them under her skin, under her winter coat, so near and full of warmth that she felt herself go hot." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Sedaris
Katie add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "A good [short story] would take me out of myself and then stuff me back in, outsized, now, and uneasy with the fit." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "<b>Résumé</b> Razors pain you, Rivers are damp, Acids stain you, And drugs cause cramp. Guns aren't lawful, Nooses give, Gas smells awful. You might as well live." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Katie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Katie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Love is so short, forgetting is so long." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Katie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Someday, somewhere - anywhere, unfailingly, you'll find yourself, and that, and only that, can be the happiest or bitterest hour of your life." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Katie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I want To do with you what spring does with the cherry trees." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Katie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I can write the saddest poem of all tonight. I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Katie add a quote by pablo neruda
item.description: "You are like nobody since I love you." -- pablo neruda

item.title: Katie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Laughter is the language of the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Katie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "To feel the love of people whom we love is a fire that feeds our life." -- Pablo Neruda
